alice.tucson.api

Class SpawnActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tucson.api.SpawnActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class SpawnActivity
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
    The "parallel computation" to be started with a spawn primitive. The spawned activity should be a PURELY COMPUTATIONAL (algorithmic) process, with the purpose to delegate computations to the coordination medium. For this reason, a set of "constrained" Linda primitives are provided: they CANNOT access a remote space. Furthermore, the programmer is strongly encouraged not to put communications, locks or other potentially "extra-algorithmic" features in its SpawnActivity.
    Author:
    ste (mailto: s.mariani@unibo.it)
    See Also:

        public final void setSpawnerId(TucsonAgentId aid)
        Linda operations used in the spawned activity are performed ON BEHALF of the agent who issued the spawn (its "owner").
        Parameters:
        aid - the identifier of the agent "owner" of the spawned activity.

      • setSpawnerId

        public final void setSpawnerId(TucsonTupleCentreId tcid)
        Linda operations used in the spawned activity are performed ON BEHALF of the tuplecentre who issued the spawn (its "owner").
        Parameters:
        tcid - the identifier of the tuplecentre "owner" of the spawned activity.

      • setTargetTC

        public final void setTargetTC(TucsonTupleCentreId tcid)
        The tuplecentre target, which will "host" the spawned computation. It is automagically set by the ReSpecT engine.
        Parameters:
        tcid - the identifier of the tuplecentre target of the spawned activity.

      • getTargetTC

        public final TucsonTupleCentreId getTargetTC()
        Gets the tuplecentre identifier hosting the spawned activity.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the tuplecentre hosting the spawned activity.

      • getSpawnerId

        public final TucsonIdWrapper<?> getSpawnerId()
        Both agents and the coordination medium itself can spawn a computation, hence we need to handle both.
        Returns:
        the "spawner" id (actually, a generic wrapper hosting either a TucsonAgentId or a TucsonTupleCentreId, accessible with method getId())
        See Also:
        TucsonIdWrapper
